title: BENCH PRESS
description: An exercise that’s key for building upper body strength. To perform this exercise properly, you’ll need to use an Olympic bar or dumbbells for better muscle recruitment.

title: BOSU SQUATS
description: The unstable surface will help develop core strength, balance and strengthen the ankle stabilisers, which can help prevent common ankle injuries that footballers suffer from.

title: BOX JUMP
description: This is a plyometric movement that will help develop strength and power in your legs, specifically the hamstrings, glute's and quads.movement that starts with a muscle

title: FOAM ROLLER
description: Using a foam roller both before and after exercise helps massage away knots and tightness in your muscles, which in turn helps prevent injuries.It also increases flexibility

title: KNEELING PRESS-UP
description: An exercise that’s key for building upper body strength. To perform this exercise properly, you’ll need to use an Olympic bar or dumbbells for better muscle recruitment.

title: LEG RAISES
description: An exercise that’s key for building upper body strength. To perform this exercise properly, you’ll need to use an Olympic bar or dumbbells for better muscle recruitment.

title: PLANK

title: SQUAT
description: To achieve the best results, use a heavy weight, with fewer reps to increase strength and muscle mass, or use lighter weights(or simply your body weight) with explosive .

title: TREADMILL INTERVAL
description: Playing a game for 90 minutes requires you to have great endurance combined with the ability to put in short bursts of maximum effort. Try a TABATA-style 20 second sprint
